definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: New York of course is a walking town.
sentences.chinese: 当然，纽约是个行色匆匆的城市。

sentences.english: Its few people on the road, walked quickly.
sentences.chinese: 路上人群稀落，行色匆匆。

sentences.english: Try to have compassion for the person and remember how painful it is to be in such an enormous hurry.
sentences.chinese: 试着怜悯那个人，记住这样行色匆匆结果是多么痛苦。

sentences.english: We are going nowhere, but fast.
sentences.chinese: 我们无处可去，却行色匆匆。

definition: endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
the stream flows without stopping (idiom); unending flow
to be busy rushing about/to bustle about
to travel back and forth/to shuttle
lit. rubbing shoulders and following in each other's footsteps/a thronging crowd
